metadata.title: CVE-2017-5043 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Chrome Apps in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.98 for Linux, Windows, andMac had a use after free bug in GuestView, which allowed a remote attackerto perform an out of bounds memory read via a crafted Chrome extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5043` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-browser-l10n - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-chromedriver - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276').
